segment.source: Deploy .NET Framework 3.5 by using Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM)
segment.target: Deploy .NET Framework 3.5 by using Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM)

segment.source: Deploy .NET Framework 3.5 by using Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM)
segment.target: Deploy .NET Framework 3.5 by using Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM)

segment.source: Deploy .NET Framework 3.5 by using Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM)
segment.target: Deploy .NET Framework 3.5 by using Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM)

segment.source: You can use the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) command-line tool to create a modified image to deploy .NET Framework 3.5.
segment.target: You can use the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) command-line tool to create a modified image to deploy .NET Framework 3.5.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: For images that will support more than one language, you must add .NET Framework 3.5 binaries before adding any language packs.
segment.target: For images that will support more than one language, you must add .NET Framework 3.5 binaries before adding any language packs.

segment.source: This order ensures that .NET Framework 3.5 language resources are installed correctly in the reference image and available to users and applications.
segment.target: This order ensures that .NET Framework 3.5 language resources are installed correctly in the reference image and available to users and applications.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Using DISM with Internet connectivity
segment.target: Using DISM with Internet connectivity

segment.source: Using DISM with no Internet connectivity
segment.target: Using DISM with no Internet connectivity

segment.source: Using DISM with Internet connectivity
segment.target: Using DISM with Internet connectivity

segment.source: Requirements
segment.target: Requirements

segment.source: Internet connection
segment.target: Internet connection

segment.source: Access to Windows Update.
segment.target: Access to Windows Update.

segment.source: If the PC or server is behind a firewall or uses a proxy server, see KB900935 - How the Windows Update client determines which proxy server to use to connect to the Windows Update Web site.
segment.target: If the PC or server is behind a firewall or uses a proxy server, see KB900935 - How the Windows Update client determines which proxy server to use to connect to the Windows Update Web site.

segment.source: Windows 8, Windows Server® 2012, or the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) tools.
segment.target: Windows 8, Windows Server® 2012, or the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) tools.

segment.source: Installation media
segment.target: Installation media

segment.source: Administrator user rights.
segment.target: Administrator user rights.

segment.source: The current user must be a member of the local Administrators group to add or remove Windows features.
segment.target: The current user must be a member of the local Administrators group to add or remove Windows features.

segment.source: For an online reference image that can access Windows Update
segment.target: For an online reference image that can access Windows Update

segment.source: Open a command prompt with administrator user rights (Run as Administrator) in Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012.
segment.target: Open a command prompt with administrator user rights (Run as Administrator) in Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012.

segment.source: To Install .NET Framework 3.5 feature files from Windows Update, use the following command:
segment.target: To Install .NET Framework 3.5 feature files from Windows Update, use the following command:

segment.source: Use /All to enable all parent features of the specified feature.
segment.target: Use /All to enable all parent features of the specified feature.

segment.source: For more information on DISM arguments, see Enable or Disable Windows Features Using DISM.
segment.target: For more information on DISM arguments, see Enable or Disable Windows Features Using DISM.

segment.source: On Windows 8 PCs, after installation .NET Framework 3.5 is displayed as enabled in Turn Windows features on or off in Control Panel.
segment.target: On Windows 8 PCs, after installation .NET Framework 3.5 is displayed as enabled in Turn Windows features on or off in Control Panel.

segment.source: For Windows Server 2012 systems, feature installation state can be viewed in Server Manager.
segment.target: For Windows Server 2012 systems, feature installation state can be viewed in Server Manager.

segment.source: For an offline reference image
segment.target: For an offline reference image

segment.source: Run the following DISM command (image mounted to the c:testoffline folder and the installation media in the D:drive) to install .NET 3.5:
segment.target: Run the following DISM command (image mounted to the c:testoffline folder and the installation media in the D:drive) to install .NET 3.5:

segment.source: Use /All to enable all parent features of the specified feature.
segment.target: Use /All to enable all parent features of the specified feature.

segment.source: Use /LimitAccess to prevent DISM from contacting Windows Update/WSUS.
segment.target: Use /LimitAccess to prevent DISM from contacting Windows Update/WSUS.

segment.source: Use /Source to specify the location of the files that are needed to restore the feature.
segment.target: Use /Source to specify the location of the files that are needed to restore the feature.

segment.source: To use DISM from an installation of the Windows ADK, locate the Windows ADK servicing folder and navigate to this directory.
segment.target: To use DISM from an installation of the Windows ADK, locate the Windows ADK servicing folder and navigate to this directory.

segment.source: By default, DISM is installed at C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits8.0Assessment and Deployment KitDeployment Tools.
segment.target: By default, DISM is installed at C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits8.0Assessment and Deployment KitDeployment Tools.

segment.source: You can install DISM and other deployment and imaging tools, such as Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM), on another supported operating system from the Windows ADK.
segment.target: You can install DISM and other deployment and imaging tools, such as Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM), on another supported operating system from the Windows ADK.

segment.source: For information about DISM-supported platforms, see DISM Supported Platforms.
segment.target: For information about DISM-supported platforms, see DISM Supported Platforms.

segment.source: Run the following command to look up the status of .NET Framework 3.5 (offline image mounted to c:testoffline):
segment.target: Run the following command to look up the status of .NET Framework 3.5 (offline image mounted to c:testoffline):

segment.source: A status of Enable Pending indicates that the image must be brought online to complete the installation.
segment.target: A status of Enable Pending indicates that the image must be brought online to complete the installation.

segment.source: Using DISM with no Internet connectivity
segment.target: Using DISM with no Internet connectivity

segment.source: You can use DISM to add .NET Framework 3.5 and provide access to the sourcesSxS folder on the installation media to an installation of Windows® that is not connected to the Internet.
segment.target: You can use DISM to add .NET Framework 3.5 and provide access to the sourcesSxS folder on the installation media to an installation of Windows® that is not connected to the Internet.

segment.target: Requirements

segment.target: Windows 8, Windows Server 2012, or the Windows ADK tools.

segment.source: Open a command prompt with administrator user rights (Run as Administrator) in Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012.
segment.target: Open a command prompt with administrator user rights (Run as Administrator) in Windows 8 or Windows Server 2012.

segment.source: To install .NET Framework 3.5 from installation media located on the D: drive, use the following command:
segment.target: To install .NET Framework 3.5 from installation media located on the D: drive, use the following command:

segment.source: Use /All to enable all parent features of the specified feature.
segment.target: Use /All to enable all parent features of the specified feature.

segment.source: Use /LimitAccess to prevent DISM from contacting Windows Update/WSUS.
segment.target: Use /LimitAccess to prevent DISM from contacting Windows Update/WSUS.

segment.source: Use /Source to specify the location of the files that are needed to restore the feature.
segment.target: Use /Source to specify the location of the files that are needed to restore the feature.

segment.source: For more information on DISM arguments, see Enable or Disable Windows Features Using DISM.
segment.target: For more information on DISM arguments, see Enable or Disable Windows Features Using DISM.

segment.target: On Windows 8 PCs, after installation, .NET Framework 3.5 is displayed as enabled in Turn Windows features on or off in Control Panel.
